title: Regio XIV (Transtiberim)
description: The fourteenth regio of imperial Rome was created by the Augustan administrative reform of 7 BCE. This region contained, in addition to the named monuments, the statio of the seventh cohort of the Vigiles, 78 shrines (aediculae), 150 townhouses, 22 warehouses (horrea), 86 bathhouses, and 180 fountains. At the beginning of the fifth century, the Regio was subdivided into 78 districts or vici and 4,405 insulae.
